qas.question: Who were the main leaders of the ruling party?

answers.text: David Cameron, Nick Clegg and Ed Miliband

qas.question: Who criticized Milliband for posing with a copy of The Sun showing the Hillsborough disaster?

answers.text: Liverpool Labour MPs and the city's Labour Mayor, Joe Anderson

qas.question: How did Milliband explain posing with this newspaper?

answers.text: promoting England's bid to win the World Cup

qas.question: Who was the Labour Mayour of Liverpool?
What emotion did many people feel over The Sun's coverage of Hillsborough?

context: The main party leaders, <a0_0>David Cameron, Nick Clegg and Ed Miliband<a0_0/>, were all depicted holding a copy of the special issue in publicity material. Miliband's decision to pose with a copy of The Sun received a strong response. Organisations representing the relatives of Hillsborough victims described Miliband's action as an "absolute disgrace" and he faced criticism too from <a1_0>Liverpool Labour MPs and the city's Labour Mayor, <a3_0>Joe Anderson<a3_0/><a1_0/>. A statement was issued on 13 June explaining that Miliband "was <a2_0>promoting England's bid to win the World Cup<a2_0/>", although "he understands the <a4_0>anger<a4_0/> that is felt towards the Sun over Hillsborough by many people in Merseyside and he is sorry to those who feel offended."
